{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = |image1_size = |caption = PTA01/00 - TV Wireless Network USB Adapter |caption2 = |pp = |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = |wikipedia = |brand = Philips |model = PTA01 |submodelappend = |submodel = /00 |revision = |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = March 23, 2011 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/Philips_PTA01 |sernum = |wlclass = N150 |series = |if = USB |if_bus_version = 2.0 |ifconnector = Male A |formfactor = dongle |vendor_id = 0471 |device_id = 209e |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = BOUWUB1110 |icid = |us_id = |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = 5C:33:8E |chip1 = Atheros;AR9271; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = U.FL |antenna = |txchains = 1 |rxchains = 1 |sstreams = 1 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |802.11n = 150 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = Alpha Networks |manuf_model = WUS-N11 |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 05/13/2010 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B003CXT2W4 |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== This device is used with some Philips TVs. :CMIIT ID: 2010DJ1591 :Anatel: 0865-10-6021 [http://forum.wdlxtv.com/viewtopic.php?f=31&t=4713 ID mention] The device USB ID was added to Linux kernel version 4.1, but the chipset is supported since kernel v2.6.35. For kernel versions earlier than v4.1, you can add the ID manually: 
modprobe ath9k_htc
echo 0471 209e > /sys/bus/usb/drivers/ath9k_htc/new_id
To add the ID permanently, see: [http://pastebin.com/aAu9bRzP Easy tutorial on setting up pta01/00 on linux (Linux driver)] You can use your PTA-01 on Windows. Inside, there is Atheros AR9271. You can find it here: [https://www.atheros-drivers.com/download-driver-for-Atheros-chipset-with-id-64-and-Windows7-64bit.html Windows 7 (64bit) driver] Just manually install driver, and if ask that it's not correct driver, say Yes. This is a picture of an opened stick: [http://upload.slike.com/slike/ETNr.jpg image], From the picture, it appears to be a [[Philips WUB1110]]. The FCC ID of the WUB1110 (BOUWUB1110) has been assigned to it. [[Category:English Documentation]]
